discourse_list.title: Maker Wormhole new name: Maker Teleport

content.content: Hi, Maker fam. As you may know, the Protocol Engineering Core Unit is working to build a product that will allow DAI transfers across Layer 2 domains. As described in this post, the name chosen for this product was Maker Wormhole. Nevertheless, Jump Trading has been building a bridge product with a similar name for quite some time. They also acquired the domain wormhole.com as part of its branding strategy. This is why between the Brand Team and Protocol Engineering Core Unit we decided to rename the Maker Wormhole as Maker Teleport. This new name will allow us to continue promoting this amazing product with the same original narrative, avoiding any type of confusion and taking into account the following advantages in terms of branding:  The name is aligned with the impact we want to have on the user experience. This will help users to remember this product according to its actual functionality. The name is easy to remember and has never been used by any bridge that has similar products. We will be the first to position this name. The name will allow us to continue to build the same narrative around the product and then move forward with the communication strategy without any major changes that might delay this process.   220506_MakerDAO_Screens-081920×657 47.5 KB  Teleport your Dai. Use Maker Teleport. Coming soon!  6eplC4HlXm8x5Hs8o8scKuKHVuKOCUhEzOEkwIklhRbcOauJ6qSRl84yGdHIYkqvNJsoPVqo3or4f3tL-jezsREiw8U1ewIspWPt48Fgbr0ZlxICgT58Xye_sev8bMb_iLQXZ5N5960×960 253 KB
Why not just MakerPort?

Excellent the name change, without a doubt I think it transmits more the essence of what the product is. What makes me curious is if the purchase of this domain was not planned from the beginning, what failed, the time or maybe the maker’s disposition?

Doo_StableLab:  Why not just MakerPort?   It’s a good name! We brainstormed and didn’t get that one . We got others like the Maker Portal, Gate, Dark Hole (this one is bad idea you don’t want to put your money into a Dark Hole), Gateway, Stargate, etc. Thing is that now that we’ve decided on the new name and made more progress on designing, it’s even harder than before to change everything back. I’m sure that Maker Teleport is gonna be a great product name for our users!     Alefcripto:  What makes me curious is if the purchase of this domain was not planned from the beginning, what failed, the time or maybe the maker’s disposition?   As far as I know, we haven’t planned to purchase that specific domain, but the fact that another similar product has already bought it is an important branding action to have more power over the name.
Great name!

Also MakerGate! Maker Teleport is fine but feels less likely to be used casually like “oh just use MakerPort”. Anyway good to get away from Wormhole, I kept seeing talk of a bridge called Wormhole and was concerned about the name clash
MakerGate sounds super nice too, maybe we should brought the brainstorm session to a Governance Call or create a forum post. But yeah, everything that’s not Wormhole is good!
TeleMaker would been ok too. Though it sounds like outsourcing company
MakerGate sounds like a political scandal.

I think Maker Teleport is a great name. To me, MakerGate or MakerPort just sounds like a regular bridge - ‘teleport’ better communicates the distinctive benefits of the product, ie superfast withdrawals. The memetic value of ‘teleportation’ seems potent in representing some of DeFi’s structural advantages, so I am surprised it hasn’t been seized by a protocol already.
I can imagine someone using MakerGate to describe a scandal in next 2 years

First of all, really happy to see this. I voiced my concerns regarding the name to a bunch of people. To move on, I’d just throw something in: The bridge space is incredibly complex and getting more complex on a weekly basis. At LI.FI we get to know these projects months before they are even announced. For your name you want to find something distinguished but clear, inheriting your brand’s trustworthy name. Just call it what it is: MakerBridge “Need to move a 100 mio.+? Use MakerBridge.” - Doesn’t need an explanation. Don’t go fancy and please search before you pick a name - just to make sure there is nothing in the bridge space already: https://portr.xyz/ (Teleportr) - has been one of the earliest bridge projects, even though I believe it’s dead. https://teleport.network/ - a project to " Accelerate crypto assets & dApps to multi-chain"

Hey Philipp, thank you for your perspective! The Bridge name was chosen and widely used by the community to name products that want to transfer assets from one chain to another. Nevertheless, the current functionality of these “Bridges” only operates the lock-mint scheme, which doesn’t provide the best user experience. On top of that, the name Bridge has been a target to refer to one of the biggest risks of the multi-chain world. The Maker Teleport is different and we want to highlight the difference. As described in the introduction, what happens when you transfer Dai from one L2 to another is much like an actual teleporting — Dai is destroyed in the origin and minted in the destination. When it comes to user experience, specifically on security, speed, and costs, the Maker Teleport makes a huge improvement over traditional bridges. This is how we want to promote it. Teleporting is superior to bridging. Cheaper, faster, and without losing the Dai essence and the Maker security
I like wormhole from a historical perspective. But using that word when trying to onboard can make things a bit more puzzling for people. They hear wormhole and its over.
They can’t use MakerGate as a scandal if we already take the name for a product.  This is good defensive strategy  I vote for Maker Quantum Tunnel
I like Maker Portal   Then the memes I’ve made still apply too  Maybe Dai Portal
Capture735×425 27 KB
Yesss
haha it would be a very good concept indeed
Let DAI be your companion…
Just a minor update, I shared partners about the new name and they were asking whether there’s a shorter version
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
